title: How two seismic Week 15 injuries impacted the NFL: Barnwell on Parsons, Mahomes and the fallout
content: Micah Parsons and Patrick Mahomes both suffered significant knee injuries Sunday. What do they mean for the Packers' playoff push and the Chiefs' offseason plans?

title: Mahomes tears ACL as Chiefs' playoff hopes end
content: Patrick Mahomes suffered a torn ACL in the closing minutes of Sunday's loss to the Chargers, an MRI confirmed. "Don't know why this had to happen," he wrote on social media. "And not going to lie, [it] hurts."

title: Source: Pack's Parsons believed to have torn ACL
content: The initial belief is that the Packers' Micah Parsons suffered a torn ACL, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: McCarthy hits 'Griddy' before TD, irking O'Connell
content: Vikings coach Kevin O'Connell was displeased with J.J. McCarthy's modified "Griddy" touchdown dance, a celebration the QB admitted he had been warned not to do.

title: Rivers: Return was 'blast,' but loss stings most
content: In his stunning return after nearly five full seasons in retirement, Philip Rivers started at quarterback for the Colts and positioned them to win before a late collapse by Indy in an 18-16 loss to the Seahawks on Sunday.

title: Pavia sorry for 'disrespectful' Heisman reaction
content: Vanderbilt quarterback Diego Pavia, the Heisman Trophy runner-up, apologized Sunday for "being disrespectful" in a social media post he made after Indiana's Fernando Mendoza won the award for college football's best player.

title: LeBron seals win after Brooks antics earn ejection
content: After hitting a go-ahead 3-pointer with 12.2 seconds left, Suns forward Dillon Brooks earned his second technical foul for bumping his old nemesis, LeBron James, and was ejected. The Lakers superstar went on to secure the 116-114 win for L.A.

title: Aggies shock unbeaten volleyball No. 1 Huskers
content: The NCAA women's volleyball tournament was rocked Sunday as Texas A&M upset previously unbeaten No. 1 Nebraska, sending the Aggies to the program's first final four. Hours later, Texas was the second top seed ousted on its home court, losing to Wisconsin.

title: Wiggin, coach who lost on 'The Play,' dies at 91
content: Paul Wiggin, the former Stanford and Cleveland Browns star who was on the losing end of "The Play" as the coach of star quarterback John Elway and the Cardinal, died Friday. He was 91.

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today

title: The Misidentification Of Ahmed Al Ahmed, Sydney Bondi Beach Shooting Hero
content: In the hours after one of the deadliest mass shootings in modern Australian history, the footage that travelled fastest across social media was of a man lunging from behind, wrapping his arms around a gunman, wrestling a firearm away.

title: Centre To Replace MGNREGA With G Ram G, Congress Asks "Problem With Bapu?"
content: Setting the stage for a political face-off during the ongoing Winter Session of Parliament, the Centre has introduced a Bill that will replace the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee scheme (MGNREGA)

title: For First Time In 50 Years, Japan Will Be Panda-Less As Twins Leave Tokyo
content: Popular twin pandas at a Tokyo zoo are set to return to their homeland in China in late January, officials said Monday, leaving Japan without a panda for the first time in about half a century.

title: "Would Do It Again": Man Who Snatched Gun From Sydney Shooter May Lose Arm
content: The bystander who lunged at a gunman and disarmed him during Sunday's Bondi Beach attack is fighting for his life in hospital. Ahmed Al Ahmed, 43, now says he would do it again, despite the pain from being "riddled with bullets."

title: Video: Moment Sydney Victim Confronted Attacker Before Being Shot Dead
content: When two gunmen opened fire on people at a Jewish festival on Sydney's popular Bondi Beach, killing 15 of them, there was one person who exemplified courage.

title: Video: Students Huddle In Brown University Library After Campus Shooting Kills 2
content: A group of students took refuge inside a Brown University building during the tense moments following a deadly shooting on campus that left two students dead and nine others injured.

title: Cryptic 'Marathi Manoos' Posters Surface In Mumbai As Civic Polls Announced
content: On the day the election commission in Maharashtra announced long-pending municipal corporation elections, after a delay of more than three years, posters surfaced across parts of Mumbai, carrying messages appealing to the city's Marathi manoos.

title: 'Deities Not Allowed To Rest': Top Court On Special Pujas For The Rich
content: The Supreme Court on Monday expressed unhappiness over the practice of allowing people to do 'special pujas' in temples after paying money, disrupting the "resting time" of deity

title: Aviation Ministry Officials Review Airport Preps As Fog Descends On Delhi
content: Officials of the Civil Aviation ministry visited Delhi airport's Operations Control Centre today as fog hit the city in a big way.

title: Supreme Court Asks Why Full Audio Not Sent To Lab In Manipur Tapes Case, Government To Reply

title: Man Who Kicked Shooter's Gun Away During Sydney Beach Attack Is A Refugee
content: An unarmed civilian's split-second courage helped prevent further bloodshed during the deadly shooting on Sydney's Bondi Beach.

title: "Felt Good To Hear Masood Azhar Cry": Ex J&K Police Chief On Leaked Audio
content: Most wanted terrorist Masood Azhar breaking down during a speech while recalling his time in jail in Jammu and Kashmir is proof that terrorists face their worst nightmare in India, former Jammu and Kashmir Police chief SP Vaid told NDTV.

title: Mother's Sarees, Father's Suicide Plan: 4 Chilling Deaths In Bihar Village
content: A man allegedly hanged his three daughters to death and then died by suicide at his home in Bihar's Muzaffarpur. Amarnath Ram allegedly tried to hang all his five children, but his two sons survived

title: Polls For Mumbai Civic Body (BMC) On January 15, Results Next Day
content: Elections for Maharashtra's civic bodies, pending since 2022, will finally be held on January 15. Elections will be held for 29 municipal corporations, 32 district councils, and 336 panchayat samitis. The votes will be counted the next day.

title: Maharashtra Man Burnt Alive Inside His Car, Body Was Found Stuffed In Sack
content: Ganesh Chavan, a resident of Ausa Tanda, was allegedly stuffed inside the sack, made to sit in his car and the vehicle was set on fire by unknown assailants.

title: Bondi Beach Shooting Live Updates:  Shooter Was On Cops Radar For 6 Years

title: Ex Yes Bank CEO Rana Kapoor Questioned in Anil Ambani Case Over Quid Pro Quo Deals

title: Bondi Beach Terror Attack Kills Rabbi Who Commemorated 26/11 Mumbai Victims
content: A rabbi, who recently helped organise a memorial for the Chabad emissaries killed in the 2008 Mumbai attacks, was among the 15 victims of an antisemitic terror attack at Bondi Beach in Sydney, Australia.

title: "Nothing To Do...": Omar Abdullah Draws INDIA-Congress Line On 'Vote Chori'

title: Opinion: Opinion | India's Exclusion From US' Pax Silica Club Isn't A Snub - But It Matters
content: India is not part of the initial grouping. Some see this as a snub. Others say it doesn't matter. Both reactions miss the point. The issue is not optics. It's whether India is moving fast enough to be treated as a partner rather than a customer.

title: MTC‚Äôs ‚Äòbus first‚Äô campaign receives mixed response
content: Most people say buses must not be given priority as they don‚Äôt stop at designated bays, and are driven recklessly; some, however, say rash driving by other motorists puts bus drivers to hardship

content: Promises of data-entry jobs draw young men from Gujarat across the Moei river into Myanmar‚Äôs alleged cyber-fraud compounds.¬†Abhinay Deshpande¬†reports on their passage, from aspiration to captivity, and their eventual return to India

title: Sangeeta Barooah Pisharoty elected first woman president of Press Club of India
content: Ms. Pisharoty's team swept all office-bearers and managing committee positions, scoring an emphatic 21-0, in the elections held on Saturday (December 13).

title: Despite Seeman attending right wing outfit‚Äôs event, NTK leaders rule out NDA tie-up
content: Packiarasan Sethuramalingam, a close party aide of Mr. Seeman and spokesperson, says while it is true they want to send their representatives into the State Assembly, it needs to be only on their terms

title: Neither Amit Shah nor Sangh army can succeed in Tamil Nadu, says Chief Minister Stalin
content: He accuses the right wing of spreading lies and regressive ideas disguised as honey-coated pills to deceive the people. He says the ideology of the DMK is an antidote to politics of the BJP

title: Shamanuru Shivashankarappa: Senior-most MLA, Lingayat leader, industrialist and more
content: Senior-most incumbent MLA in India and a Lingayat strongman of the Congress, 94-year-old Shamanur Shivashankarappa, who passed away on Sunday, will be remembered not just for the empire he built as an industrialist and educationist, but also for his politics and the work he did as president of the All India Veerashaiva Lingayat Mahasabha

title: Tamil kings, freedom fighters didn‚Äôt get due recognition earlier: Vice-President
content: The V-P releases a commemorative postage stamp honouring Emperor Perumbidugu Mutharaiyar II; lauds government efforts recognising unsung heroes essential to revive nation‚Äôs cultural pride

title: Priyanka Gandhi dares the BJP to contest a fair election using ballot paper
content: The Congress MP said youth are driven towards substance abuse and betting apps because of unemployment; alleges a PMO official to be involved in betting scam but doesn‚Äôt name anyone.

title: M.P. Minister Vijay Shah stirs a fresh furore with comments on Ladli Behna scheme
content: The minister issued directions that beneficiary women should felicitate Chief Minister Mohan Yadav in a special ceremony

title: Jaishankar meets European, U.K., Egyptian counterparts at U.A.E. summit
content: The Minister was in the U.A.E. capital Abu Dhabi to attend the three-day Sir Bani Yas Forum 2025, which concluded on Sunday (December 14, 2025)

title: Pak national, unemployed: What we know about Bondi beach shooters ‚Äî key findings
content: Tragedy struck Bondi Beach as a father-son duo unleashed gunfire at a Hanukkah event, claiming at least 15 lives. The attackers, identified as Sajid and Naveed Akram, opened fire from a footbridge. Police neutralised Sajid, while Naveed was apprehended. Investigations are underway, with possible links to extremist groups being explored.

title: Watch: CM Nitish Kumar pulls down woman's hijab at event; Cong, RJD slam 'vile act'
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar removed the hijab of a woman AYUSH doctor during an appointment letter distribution event in Patna. The incident, captured on video, has sparked political criticism, with the Rashtriya Janata Dal accusing the CM of a "Sanghi" mindset. The doctor appeared visibly upset after the headscarf was removed.

title: Why from Bihar & why now? Nitin Nabin takes charge as BJP working prez; big signal by party
content: Nitin Nabin, a 45-year-old Bihar minister, has been appointed BJP's working president, positioning him to become the youngest national president. His selection, seen as a strategic move by Prime Minister Modi and Amit Shah, signals a generational shift within the party. Nabin's five-term MLA experience and organizational skills have been highlighted as key factors in his rapid ascent.

title: Jeff Bezos‚Äô dream job: Amazon founder did not want tech job; Wanted to be bartender
content: Jeff Bezos, the founder of Amazon, revealed his dream job was not leading a tech empire but crafting high-end cocktails as a bartender. While he admits to glamorizing the role and being too slow for the fast-paced profession, Bezos has still made billions from Amazon and is now involved in a new AI startup, Project Prometheus.

title: Viksit Bharat Adhishthan Bill: Rs 2cr fine for illegal universities
content: The Cabinet-approved Viksit Bharat Adhishthan Bill proposes a ‚Çπ2-crore penalty and immediate shutdown for unapproved universities. But while the law sharpens punishment for institutions, it leaves students exposed. This explainer decodes what happens to degrees when universities are shut, what current law says ‚Äî and why students must verify recognition before admission.

title: From tech city to tanker city: Inside Bengaluru‚Äôs deepening water crisis
content: Bengaluru's water crisis deepens as residents rely on state-run tankers, a temporary fix for a failing system. Decades of neglect have decimated ancient lake networks, leaving the city dependent on costly, unreliable water sources. This reliance on tankers, while offering immediate relief, masks a critical need for long-term solutions to prevent a future water emergency.

title: 25 years of 'cloud': Salesforce CEO says it's over: Company may rename itself
content: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff has ditched the word "cloud," a significant shift for the tech pioneer. Focus groups revealed customers now prioritize discussing AI agents over cloud technology. This pivot is underscored by renaming products to "Agentforce" and a massive bet on AI, evidenced by layoffs and substantial deal closures, aiming for $60 billion in revenue by 2030.

title: MGNREGA renaming row: Cong claims conspiracy; what new scheme proposes
content: Opposition leaders have strongly criticized the Centre's move to repeal and replace the MGNREGA, questioning the removal of Mahatma Gandhi's name. Critics allege a conspiracy to dismantle a rights-based law, calling the renaming hypocritical and an insult to the Father of the Nation. The proposed bill aims to revamp rural employment with a new framework.

title: Watch: India displays Turkish drone used by Pak in Op Sindoor; was going to hit Jalandhar
content: The Indian Army displayed a Turkish-made Yiha kamikaze drone, shot down on May 10 during a conflict with Pakistan. Launched from Lahore with a 10-kg explosive payload, the drone was intended for Jalandhar but was intercepted by Army Air Defence. Pakistan deployed numerous such drones during the clashes.

title: PM Modi in Jordan: To hold talks with King Abdullah II; what's at stake
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi commenced a three-nation tour in Jordan, marking 75 years of diplomatic ties. He will then visit Ethiopia, a key African Union hub, to bolster bilateral relations and address Parliament. The tour concludes in Oman, aiming to deepen their strategic partnership and economic ties, with engagements including diaspora meetings.

title: Nvidia responds to report claiming China's DeepSeek that wiped billions from US stock market in January 2025, is using 'banned' Nvidia chips
content: Nvidia has denied reports that Chinese AI startup DeepSeek is using smuggled Blackwell GPUs, calling the claims "far-fetched." The US has banned these advanced chips from export to China to maintain its AI lead. DeepSeek's previous AI model launch at a lower cost had already rattled US markets and sparked concerns about China's AI progress.

title: 'If he does not perform': Ashwin issues blunt review as Gill struggles in T20Is
content: Shubman Gill's recent batting struggles have put India's T20 World Cup plans in a bind. With only seven T20Is left, the vice-captain's form is under scrutiny, intensifying debate over Sanju Samson's potential inclusion. Former spinner Ravichandran Ashwin urges a fair review, highlighting the difficulty of dropping a vice-captain while stressing the need for impactful batting.

title: Rupee sinks further, hits new all-time low of 90.74 vs dollar
content: The Indian rupee hit a fresh all-time low of 90.74 against the US dollar, pressured by uncertainty over an India-US trade deal and continued foreign fund outflows. Despite positive macro cues, the rupee struggled as importers' strong dollar demand and risk-averse sentiment dominated. Experts see a bullish near-term bias for the USD-INR pair.

title: IPL Auction: Green to Nortje - 10 players who could spark bidding wars
content: A total of 350 cricketers, including 240 Indians, are set for the IPL auction in Abu Dhabi on December 16. Franchises will bid for 77 slots, with top players like Cameron Green and David Miller attracting Rs 2 crore base prices. Teams are actively seeking overseas all-rounders and pace options to finalize squads for the upcoming season.

title: Connor McDavid‚Äôs wife, Lauren Kyle launches Sports Club Atelier collection
content: Lauren Kyle, wife of NHL star Connor McDavid, is launching a Canada-inspired collection for her brand, Sports Club Atelier, in January. Drawing inspiration from vintage winter advertising and alpine campaigns, the line features red-and-white pieces designed for fans to express patriotic pride fashionably at sporting events and in everyday life.

title: NHL Update: Connor McDavid reacts to Oilers trading Skinner, Kulak
content: The Edmonton Oilers made a significant roster change, trading goalie Stuart Skinner and defenseman Brett Kulak to the Pittsburgh Penguins for Tristan Jarry and Spencer Stastney. While the move addressed goaltending needs, it was acknowledged as a difficult decision by players like Connor McDavid and Head Coach Kris Knoblauch, who praised the departing players' contributions.

title: Where Does Auston Matthews Live? Inside Leafs Star‚Äôs Homes and Wealth
content: Auston Matthews' net worth is estimated at $30 million in 2025, driven by his substantial NHL salary and lucrative endorsement deals with major brands like Nike and RBC. Beyond hockey, he has strategically invested in startups and actively supports men's health through philanthropy, showcasing a multi-faceted financial profile.

title: BMC polls on Jan 15, results on Jan16; voting for 29 civic bodies across Maharashtra
content: Maharashtra will hold elections for 29 municipal corporations, including the BMC, on January 15, with results on January 16. This announcement follows a significant delay due to legal issues and reservation concerns. The polls, covering major cities like Mumbai, Pune, and Nagpur, are seen as a crucial political test for parties ahead of future state-level contests.

title: Ranveer Singh's starrer 'Dhurandhar' goes houseful in Jammu & Kashmir
content: Aditya Dhar‚Äôs 'Dhurandhar' is drawing packed crowds in Jammu & Kashmir, including towns like Shopian and Pulwama. Supported by Citara‚Äôs small-format cinemas, the film shows rising interest in big-screen entertainment beyond metros. Experts say these compact theatres fill crucial exhibition gaps and revive cinema culture in smaller regions.

title: 'I want to leave': Pen scratched Messi during Kolkata frenzy; chaos spooked Argentina star
content: Chaos erupted at Salt Lake stadium during Lionel Messi's visit after excessive VIP access led to a security breach. An autograph attempt on Messi's body escalated into a safety concern, prompting his desire to leave. This triggered widespread vandalism by disappointed fans.

title: Parking row: Actor Anuj Sachdeva attacked; how car photo in society group triggered assault
content: Actor Anuj Sachdeva suffered a brutal public assault, leaving him bleeding from the head. The incident occurred after he reported a wrongly parked car in his society. An agitated individual attacked Sachdeva and his pet dog with a rod, hurling threats. A security guard intervened, and Sachdeva shared the disturbing video online, prompting calls for a police complaint.

title: Quote of the day by Nikola Tesla: 'Life is and will ever remain an equation'
content: Nikola Tesla, a brilliant inventor, revolutionized modern technology with his work in electricity and wireless communication. Despite personal struggles, his visionary ideas continue to inspire. Tesla viewed life as an unsolvable equation, yet emphasized the importance of known factors like scientific principles and experience to navigate its mysteries with curiosity and purpose.

title: MGNREGA to be replaced by VB‚ÄìG Ram G: What it is and how it‚Äôs different ‚Äî key FAQs answered
content: The Centre is set to replace MGNREGA with the VB‚ÄìG RAM G Bill, 2025, guaranteeing 125 days of wage employment and focusing on water security, rural infrastructure, and climate resilience. This revamped law aims to boost the rural economy, benefit farmers and labourers through increased income, predictable work, and digital formalisation, addressing past systemic failures.

title: Shaheen Afridi‚Äôs nightmare BBL debut: Sent off for dangerous bowling - Watch
content: Shaheen Shah Afridi's Big Bash League debut for Brisbane Heat was a difficult outing. He was removed from bowling after delivering two dangerous full tosses, finishing his spell with figures of 0 for 43 from 2.4 overs. The Renegades capitalized on bowling lapses to post a commanding 212 for 5.

title: Ram Vilas Vedanti dies: Ram Janmabhoomi movement leader passes away at 67
content: Ram Janmabhoomi movement leader and former BJP MP Ram Vilas Vedanti passed away at the age of 67 in Rewa, Madhya Pradesh, due to a heart attack. He was admitted to the hospital with severe blood poisoning and kidney failure. Efforts to transfer him to AIIMS Bhopal by air ambulance were unsuccessful due to poor visibility.

title: Vanessa Bryant emotional as UConn, USC honour Kobe and Gigi in on-court tribute
content: The UConn Huskies beat the USC Trojans by 28 points. The game became emotional as players honored Kobe and Gigi Bryant. Both teams wore different Kobe sneakers. Vanessa Bryant shared pictures of the athletes on her Instagram. This tribute highlighted the lasting impact of Kobe and Gigi on basketball. Gigi had wished to play for UConn.

title: Delhi‚Äôs toxic air: 82% know someone ill due to pollution - Study
content: A new survey reveals 82% of Delhi-NCR residents know someone suffering serious health issues attributed to long-term air pollution exposure. This comes as Delhi's AQI reached 498, in the 'severe' category, exacerbating a public health crisis and raising concerns about affording medical treatment.

title: Sydney attack: Rabbi who organised 26/11 memorial among victims; survived by wife, 5 children
content: Sydney's Jewish community mourns Rabbi Eli Schlanger, a victim of a recent antisemitic attack. Just days prior, he honored victims of the 2008 Mumbai terror. Schlanger, a dedicated community leader, actively campaigned against rising antisemitism. The attack, Australia's worst in decades, has prompted calls for solidarity from global leaders.

title: Why UK work visas for Indians are falling: Nursing visas down by 79% & more
content: UK immigration changes introduced in July 2025 are significantly impacting Indian professionals and students, with sharp drops in visa approvals for healthcare, IT, and student routes. Tighter criteria, higher salary thresholds, and reduced post-study work periods are forcing many to reconsider their plans or look to alternative destinations like Canada and Australia.

title: 'Vote chori is Cong issue': Abdullah's distances INDIA bloc from Rahul's choir against EC
content: In a recent statement, Jammu and Kashmir's Chief Minister Omar Abdullah clarified that his party does not align with the Congress-led 'vote chori' initiative, asserting that the INDIA coalition remains uninvolved. He underscored the importance of each political faction crafting its own narrative while urging the Election Commission to maintain its autonomy and impartiality, highlighting concerns raised in Bihar.

title: China‚Äôs $1 tn trade surplus! Winning on export front ‚Äî how is Beijing dealing with Trump‚Äôs tariff hit
content: Despite US tariffs, China's trade surplus hit a record $1 trillion, driven by global demand for its goods. Exporters pivoted from the US to Europe, Asia, and Africa. This resilience, fueled by manufacturing strength and weak domestic demand, bolsters Beijing's stance in trade talks, though concerns about sustainability and global trade tensions persist.

title: Reasons for Messi mess: Neta clans‚Äô selfie rush; pen scratching icon‚Äôs hand set off alarm
content: The electrifying atmosphere at Salt Lake Stadium turned sour during Messi's visit, when eager fans found themselves unable to catch a glimpse of their idol. A misguided attempt by a VIP to secure an autograph sparked concerns for safety, forcing an early departure for the soccer legend.

title: Bold warning! 'We will 'trap' Vaibhav Suryavanshi': Malaysia captain
content: Young Vaibhav Suryavanshi's stellar 171 against UAE was followed by a quiet 5 against Pakistan. Malaysia captain Deeaz Patro, inspired by David Warner and with an Odisha connection, plans strategies to dismiss Suryavanshi. Aalif, a Virat Kohli admirer, also looks forward to the challenge.

title: 'Thoughtful analysis': Tharoor shares post comparing his ideas with Rahul; what it said
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor reposted a thread comparing his political approach to Rahul Gandhi's, calling the analysis "fair" and "reflective of a certain perception of the current reality." The thread criticized Gandhi's rural-centric policies as "devastating" and highlighted Tharoor's alignment with his background and audience.

title: Building a sensible portfolio: How many stocks are enough? Explained
content: Investors often fall into extremes with stock portfolios, either too concentrated or overly diversified. A balanced approach, typically 10-20 stocks, is recommended. Key to success is sensible position sizing, avoiding tiny holdings, and ensuring sector diversification to mitigate risks and enhance overall portfolio performance.

title: Dhurandhar' box office collection day 11: Ranveer Singh starrer crosses Rs 350 crore
content: Aditya Dhar's 'Dhurandhar' is shattering box office records, surpassing expectations with its phenomenal run. The film starring Ranveer Singh and a stellar cast achieved a massive Rs 351.75 crore in just ten days, boasting the biggest second weekend ever. Its incredible word-of-mouth momentum has propelled it past 'Pushpa 2' and hints at a potential Rs 500 crore milestone.

title: IPL Auction: Far from perfect ‚Äî champions RCB look to plug gaps in Abu Dhabi
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru, led by Rajat Patidar, finally clinched their maiden IPL title in 2025, defeating Punjab Kings. With a strong batting lineup and effective bowling, RCB enters the 2026 auction with Rs 16.40 crore and 8 slots to fill, aiming to bolster their bowling depth and middle-order options.

title: Goa club fire: Luthra bros to be deported from Thailand tomorrow; police to take custody at airport
content: Luthra brothers, co-owners of a North Goa nightclub, are being deported from Bangkok to face charges after a fatal fire on December 6, 2025. The blaze, which claimed 25 lives, is suspected to have been caused by electric firecrackers igniting the ceiling. The brothers allegedly operated the venue without proper safety permits.

title: Exclusive | 'Four-Day Tests need better over rates‚Äô - Former Australia player Tom Moody
content: Tom Moody, Desert Vipers Director of Cricket, believes the ILT20‚Äôs biggest success lies in accelerating UAE's domestic talent. He stressed that smart auctions are about needs, not wants, highlighted the evolution of coaching with changing players, and urged cricket‚Äôs governing bodies to protect Test cricket amid franchise growth ‚Äî even if that means exploring four-day Tests with stricter over-rate discipline.

title: Deadly pile-up on Delhi-Mumbai Expressway: Multiple vehicles collide due to dense fog; 4 dead
content: Dense fog on the Delhi-Mumbai Expressway led to multiple accidents on Monday morning, resulting in at least four fatalities and several injuries. A major pile-up involving over 15 vehicles near Raniyala Patakpur village claimed two lives, including a CISF inspector. Another collision in Faridabad also resulted in two deaths.

title: Drums, conch shells and saffron flags: Pankaj Chaudhary takes UP BJP charge; is 7-time MP
content: Pankaj Chaudhary, a seven-time MP, was formally appointed as the new Uttar Pradesh BJP chief in Lucknow amidst a grand 'Sangathan Parva' event. Union Minister Piyush Goyal announced the decision, highlighting the party's focus on social inclusivity with diverse representation on the dais. The ceremony saw massive worker turnout, underscoring Chaudhary's organizational strength.

title: Bondi beach attack: New video captures tense police standoff, moment shooter was neutralised
content: Tragedy struck Bondi Beach as two gunmen opened fire during a Hanukkah celebration, killing at least 15 people.  Bystanders and police bravely confronted the attackers, with one civilian disarming a gunman. Authorities are investigating the source of the weapons and potential accomplices, while the Prime Minister condemned the act as 'evil anti-Semitism'.

content: Raj Shekhar Jha is a journalist for the Times of India with over a decade of experience in reporting on national security, terrorism, crime and prisons.

title: India Inc turns to professional CEOs; hands out more million-dollar pay cheques
content: the count of professional leaders has surged nearly 71% to 145 in FY25 from 85 five years ago . the promoter CEO count has largely remained flat in the same period, going up to 65 from 60 . this trend is a sign of India Inc becoming more institutional and future-focused .

title: The NHL's best this week: Get set for the next round of the Battle of Florida
content: the next installment of the Battle of Florida will be contested between the Tampa Bay Lightning and Florida Panthers . the two teams entered the league one year apart, including the Bolts in 1992 and the Cats a year later . but the rivalry was purely geographical, with the hockey world largely focusing on other feuds or thriving franchises.

title: 2025-26 NBA buzz: The latest live updates, trades and intel from around the league
content: the 2025-26 season has reached the quarter mark, and buzz around the league is beginning to heat up . the trade season expanding on Dec. 15 was a primary topic on the Hoop Collective podcast . "it coincides with the point in the season where teams start to make some decisions about the ineptitude or ... some of the weaknesses of their roster," Windhorst said .

title: MLB offseason grades: D-backs reunite with Kelly, Mets nab Polanco
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if it's a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future or a blockbuster trade, check back in for the freshest analysis through spring training .

title: Ranking all 64 teams in College Football Playoff history
content: the new era of college football features a larger College Football Playoff and a lower bar for inclusion . the transfer portal and increased freedom of movement for players have meant that today's best teams can't stockpile awesome backups as easily as they could in the past .

title: Has Lawrence leveled up? Pats-Bills rematch? Let's overreact to Week 15
content: the playoffs will be Chiefs-free for the first time in 11 years . it means the AFC Championship Game will be contested without the Chiefs . the playoff game will be held without the chiefs for a second time in eight years, it's not an overreaction .

title: Big questions from Week 15 games: Can the Rams take the 1-seed? What now for the Chiefs?
content: quarterback Patrick Mahomes left the Chiefs' loss late in the fourth quarter with a knee injury . the quarterbacks denied the Patriots a chance to clinch the AFC East title . texans and Jaguars also scored 40-plus points in dominant victories .
